ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were licking their lips while eating. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not lick my lips while eating,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.4_0: One should not lick one’s lips while eating.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, licks his lips while eating, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.8_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.9_0: The fourth training rule is finished.
